value: Design for a Console and Escutcheon

label: Description
value: Console with a panel and bust; center: empty escutcheon with a crown on top; at right: curved gaine with a winged bust and woman’s breast and bearded head, continued by scrolls.

value: Charcoal, brush and dark brown, gray-brown watercolor on laid paper

Sketches for Frames, for the Sacristy of St. Peter's

label: Description
value: Papal escutcheons, one of which is indicated as that of Pope Benedict XIV. The largest sketch has dimensions of the tablet of the inscription.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and sepia ink on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Top: four designs of entablature and pediments, which are decorated by moldings. Center left: left corner of an entablature, supported by a column. Bottom left: left side of an entablature and a triangular pediment. Bottom right: composite capital supporting an entablature with decorated frieze and triangular pediment.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Molded inner frame; pilaster is outside showing a bucranion at the capital; stamps are suspended from the horns; entablature. Hipped and stepped roof.
